page.title: 14Cheriton Fitz. Religion
page.content: The{Parish Church}was built in the 14th & 15th centuries,probably on the site of an earlier one.Since 1973 the Rector has led a{Team Ministry,} including two other incumbents,serving eleven parishes. A gallery, built in{ {1833}to accommodate the increasing population, was removed in{1885.}In {1965}attendance was low, but picked up under a new incumbent who introduced a sung{Eucharist}& with his own hands erected an altar for the Reserved Sacrament. Six bells are rung sometimes. The{Methodist}Church, built in 1860, is in the{Exeter Circuit}with a steady attendance. The adjoining Methodist School Room supplements the Parish Hall for meeting of Brownies, Cubs, Guides, Youth Club and an{Agency {on}Saturday mornings, where people gather for coffee and to bring and buy goods.
